text: The Wauhatchie Pike is a historic path in Lookout Mountain, Tennessee, U.S.. It was named after Wauhatchie, a Cherokee Nation chieftain. The path was an important location during the American Civil War of 1861–1865. It has been listed on the National Register of Historic Places since July 11, 2001. ==References== Category:Roads on the National Register of Historic Places in Tennessee Category:National Register of Historic Places in Hamilton County, Tennessee Category:Buildings and structures completed in 1863 Category:Hamilton County, Tennessee
title: Wauhatchie Pike
